DataElement.preferredName: FSFI 12 Past 4 Weeks Difficulty Reaching Orgasm with Sexual Stimulation or Intercourse Score 6 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A person's stated observation of how difficult it was in the past 4 weeks to reach orgasm (climax) when they had sexual stimulation or intercourse, using a 6 point Likert scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Female Sexual Function Index Past 4 Weeks Difficulty of Reaching Orgasm with Sexual Stimulation or Intercourse Score
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders._A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present._A question about how difficult it is or was to reach orgasm or climax when an individual had sexual stimulation or intercourse._A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders.

Concepts.definition: A 19-item self-report questionnaire designed to measure sexual function in women. It was developed for assessing domains of sexual functioning (e.g. sexual arousal, orgasm, satisfaction, pain) in women participating in clinical trials for arousal disorders.

Property.preferredName: Past 4 Weeks Difficulty of Reaching Orgasm with Sexual Stimulation or Intercourse Score

Concepts.definition: A period of time consisting of the 28 days before the present.

Concepts.longName: Difficulty of Reaching Orgasm with Sexual Stimulation or Intercourse
Concepts.definition: A question about how difficult it is or was to reach orgasm or climax when an individual had sexual stimulation or intercourse.
A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Female Sexuality Function Index Level of Difficulty 6 Point Scale

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was not difficult.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was not difficult.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was slightly difficult.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was slightly difficult.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was difficult.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was difficult.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was very difficult.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was very difficult.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that something is or was extremely difficult or impossible.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that something is or was extremely difficult or impossible.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating the absence of sexual activity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating the absence of sexual activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Over the past 4 weeks, when y
ReferenceDocuments.description: Over the past 4 weeks, when you had sexual stimulation or intercourse, how difficult was it for you reach orgasm (climax)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Using PRO/HRQoL Measures
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is part of a full set of items that comprise a PRO/HRQoL measure. The full set must be used without any changes to the questions or value set in order to retain the validity and reliability associated with the measure. Changes may not be made to these documents. In cases where retaining the question set intact to preserve the validity and reliability are not as important as advancing the science, questions may be used individually or in combination with other measure questions.

ReferenceDocuments.name: Scoring Manual Link
ReferenceDocuments.description: The URL citation is provided so that caDSR users can obtain materials related to instructions for administering and/or scoring the measure.
